meanings.definition: Decorate or embellish (something, especially food) with a small amount of additional items.
meanings.sent1: She likes to garnish her salads with a sprinkle of cheese.
meanings.sent2: The chef will garnish the dessert with a cherry on top.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to garnish her toy tea set with imaginary toppings.
meanings.sent4: Her smile garnished her face like a bright flower in bloom.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush delicately garnished the canvas with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: A small amount of food used to decorate or embellish a dish.
meanings.sent1: The parsley served as a garnish on the side of the plate.
meanings.sent2: The lemon slice was a perfect garnish for the iced tea.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the garnish on the plate was a tiny snack for her.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight cast a soft glow on the garnish of herbs.
meanings.sent5: The garnish of mint leaves added a refreshing touch to the drink.
